com.cleo.lexicom.external

Interface IDirectoryController

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote

    public interface IDirectoryController
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Establishes an interface for exploring and manipulating an FTP or SSH FTP client's directory structure. Refer to IActionController.getDirectoryController()

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      Size descending list sort

    • Method Detail

      • current

        java.lang.String current()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the current working directory
        Returns:
        the current working directory (returns null if session error)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • list

        DirectoryEntry[] list(java.lang.String path,
                      boolean recurse,
                      IDirectoryFilter filter,
                      int sort)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Get a directory listing
        Parameters:
        path - the directory path (or null for the current working directory)
        recurse - true if nested directories should also be listed
        filter - directory entry filter (can be null)
        sort - either NONE, ALPHABETICAL_ASCENDING, ALPHABETICAL_DESCENDING, DATE_ASCENDING, DATE_DESCENDING, SIZE_ASCENDING, or SIZE_DESCENDING
        Returns:
        the directory's entries (returns null if session error)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setContinueListingOnNonFatalErrors

        void setContinueListingOnNonFatalErrors(boolean continueListingOnNonFatalErrorsFlag)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Set flag to continue or stop if non-fatal errors are encountered when listing files and directories
        Parameters:
        continueListingOnNonFatalErrorsFlag - true if should continue listing when non-fatal errros are encountered
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • sort

        DirectoryEntry[] sort(DirectoryEntry[] list,
                      int sort)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Sort a directory listing
        Parameters:
        list - the directory listing
        sort - either ALPHABETICAL_ASCENDING, ALPHABETICAL_DESCENDING, DATE_ASCENDING, DATE_DESCENDING, SIZE_ASCENDING, or SIZE_DESCENDING
        Returns:
        the sorted directory entries
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

        boolean chdir(java.lang.String path)

        Change the current working directory
        Parameters:
        path - a relative or absolute directory path
        Returns:
        true if successful
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
